data.title: Tower Light, October 23, 1964
data.meta_description: Tower Light, October 23, 1964, tl19641023, The October 23, 1964 issue of the Tower Light, the student newspaper of the Towson State College., College and school drama, College sports, College students, Elections -- United States, Student activities, Student organizations, Student publications, Students, Foreign, Towson University -- History, pdf, English, Towson University Student Newspaper Collection, Digitized by the Internet Archive in 2010 with funding from Lyrasis Members and Sloan Foundation., 6 pages, 18165358 Bytes, Towson (Md.), Towson University. Special Collections and Archives, Vol. 17, No. 5, Page 1: Dean's list honors 174 -- Political drama is theme of Glen Players' premier -- Mock election to be held based on national ballot: Lyndon or Barry -- Debate Council to open season at Hopkins -- Frosh tests scheduled for February 1 -- Page 2: Editorial viewpoints: Meeting announced for all A & S students; Cast your vote; Re-admittance policies: are the fair?; It's been fun, but... -- In the middle (Michael B. Grossman) -- The readers' right: In defense of teachers (Ruby Kasten; About parking... (Edwina Dressel); Student Center jam -- Page 3: When you care enough to send the very best (Jeff Greenfield) -- The reader's right (continued from page 2) -- The hostage Brendan Behan is a bad boy (Paul F. Vanderbosch -- Do you have a yearbook? -- Spectrum: example of excellence: Slattery's People (Jack L. Chalker) -- In the middle (continued from page 2) -- Page 4: All the King's Men in Stephens aud. -- Page 5: Dean's list (continued from page 1) -- Harriers sprint to victory, defeat Loyola College 15-48 -- TL goofs: Towson F.D. took 3 minutes -- Bengals take first defeat: title hope dim -- Date book -- Take note: wrestling anyone? -- Scholarship deadline announced -- Page 6: Foreign students arrive at TSC: Pia & Aura (Pamela Brown); Gudrun (Irene V. Orantas); Swenn (Joanne Payton -- Henrik Ibsen subject of talk by Dr. Fagin -- Debate Council to open season at Hopkins (continued from page 1) -- Naturalists sponsor trip to Sugarloaf., Buttner, Timothy R. (editor-in-chief), Towson State College, Text, College student newspapers and periodicals, Newspapers, 1960-1969
